messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] philosophies/belief systems was:breastfeeding
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/16/03 8:15:17 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... Actually Judie, you just did a wonderful job of wording what I could not. Even the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/16/03 8:15:17 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
adonai@... writes:

> Rhonda,
>
> I am in total agreement with your philosophy, with the exception that
> I don't believe everything is pre-determined. I believe in free
> will, but we freely made our choices before we came here, so that
> while things may seem pre-determined (the kind of life we have, when
> and how we will die, etc.) that WE are the ones that pre-determined
> it, so we really did have freedom of choice, it's just that we chose
> before we were born, and now we just have to learn lessons from those
> choices.
>
>
>
> Judie
>

Actually Judie, you just did a wonderful job of wording what I could not.
Even the predestined/free will part. In fact I struggle with certain aspects,
because of lessons, but then I have this whole deal with time travel too, but
there is no way I'm getting into that here! LOL!!!

Rhonda


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] philosophies/belief systems was:brea
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oh, please get into with me.  Email me privately if you want.  I definitely believe in alternate realities, and being able to be present in the past,
messages.messageBody:
> Actually Judie, you just did a wonderful job of wording what I could not.
> Even the predestined/free will part. In fact I struggle with certain aspects,
> because of lessons, but then I have this whole deal with time travel too, but
> there is no way I'm getting into that here! LOL!!!
>
> Rhonda

Oh, please get into with me. Email me privately if you want. I
definitely believe in alternate realities, and being able to be
present in the past, present, and future at the same time, to glean
insight from those past and future experiences. I know it has
nothing to do with unschooling, so if you want to talk about it
off-list, I'd welcome it.


Judie
